events.title: International law meant to limit effects of war at breaking point, study finds
events.description: Report covering 23 conflicts over last 18 months concludes more than 100,000 civilians have been killed as war crimes rage out of control An authoritative survey of 23 armed conflicts over the last 18 months has concluded that international law seeking to limit the effects of war is at breaking point, with more than 100,000 civilians killed, while torture and rape are committed with near impunity. The extensive study by the Geneva Academy of International Humanitarian Law and Human Rights describes the deaths of 18,592 children in Gaza, growing civilian casualties in Ukraine and an ‚Äúepidemic‚Äù of sexual violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: ü™ñ International law meant to limit effects of war at breaking point, study finds

events.title: Islamic State claims attack on international airport and airbase in Niger
events.description: Motorcycle-riding militants launch strikes using heavy weaponry and drones, damaging planes belonging to Ivorian carrier and Togolese airline Islamic State in the Sahel has claimed responsibility for an audacious assault at the international airport and adjacent air force base in Niamey, the capital of Niger, according to the SITE Intelligence Group, which tracks jihadist activity and communications worldwide. The attack, which began shortly after midnight on Thursday, reportedly involved motorcycle-riding militants who launched a ‚Äúsurprise and coordinated‚Äù strike using heavy weaponry and drones, according to statements released via IS in the Sahel‚Äôs propaganda arm, Amaq news agency. Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: ü™ñ Islamic State claims attack on international airport and airbase in Niger

events.title: More than 200 killed in coltan mine collapse in eastern DRC, officials say
events.description: Rubaya mine produces about 15% of the world‚Äôs coltan, which is processed into tantalum, used in mobile phones More than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, a spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday. Rubaya produces about 15% of the world‚Äôs coltan, which is processed into tantalum ‚Äì a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Handful of sick and wounded Palestinians allowed through Rafah crossing on first day
events.description: Numbers Israel permitted to enter Egypt after reopening border were far lower than expected following delays A small number of sick and wounded Palestinians have begun crossing into Egypt to seek medical treatment after Israel permitted a limited reopening of the Palestinian territory‚Äôs Rafah border post as fragile diplomatic efforts to stabilise the conflict inch forward. About 150 people were due to leave the territory on Monday, and 50 to enter it, according to Egyptian officials, more than 20 months after Israeli forces closed the crossing. However, by nightfall, Reuters reported that Israel had permitted 12 Palestinians to re-enter the territory, according to Palestinian and Egyptian sources. A further 38 had not cleared security and would wait on the Egyptian side of the crossing overnight, it said. Continue reading...

events.title: Living hell of North Korea‚Äôs ‚Äòparadise on Earth‚Äô scheme back in spotlight in Japan
events.description: Plaintiffs in case say they were lured from Japan, exploited for labour and cut off from families for generations It has been more than six decades since Eiko Kawasaki left Japan to begin a new life in North Korea . Then 17, she was among tens of thousands of people with Korean heritage who had been lured to the communist state by the promise of a ‚Äúparadise on Earth‚Äù. Instead, they encountered something closer to a living hell. They were denied basic human rights and forced to endure extreme hardship. Official promises of free education and healthcare plus guaranteed jobs and housing had been a cruel mirage. And to their horror, they were prevented from travelling to Japan to visit the families they had left behind. Continue reading...

events.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
events.description: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.

events.title: Takeaways from the latest Epstein files. And, police search for Savannah Guthrie's mom
events.description: NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.

events.title: Iranians seeking to punish ruling elite go after the next best thing -- their kids
events.description: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.

events.title: What to know to know ahead of the negotiations between U.S. and Iran
events.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Suzanne Maloney, vice president and director of the foreign policy program at the Brookings Institution, about U.S. negotiations with Iran.

events.title: Trump hosts Colombia's Petro at White House
events.description: The visit comes as Trump has accused the Colombian president of pumping cocaine into the US, while Petro has been a vocal critic of US actions in Venezuela. But the meeting seemed to go far better than expected.

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.description: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.
events.ticker_label: üí• Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.description: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies ‚Äî and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Vietnam boosts EU partnership to match ties to China, US
events.description: The EU agreed to a "Comprehensive Strategic Partnership" with Vietnam, its biggest trading partner in Southeast Asia, during Antonio Costa's visit to Hanoi. But Russia, China and the US have all gotten there first.

events.title: Ultra-processed foods 'engineered' like cigarettes: study
events.description: A new study has drawn parallels between the addictive qualities of ultra-processed foods (UPFs) and tobacco products and called for similar levels of regulation.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.description: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Germany news: 13 million living at risk of poverty
events.description: The share of people living at risk of poverty has increased to 16%, up a percentage point from the year earlier. Meanwhile, authorities have questioned the moderate stance of the AfD's new youth wing. DW has the latest.

events.title: Norway: Son of crown princess on trial over rape charges
events.description: Marius Borg Hoiby, the son of Norwegian Crown Princess Mette-Marit, denies four counts of rape but faces over 30 other charges just days after his mother was named several hundred times in the Epstein files.

events.title: Police raid Paris offices of Musk's X over child sexual deepfakes
events.description: The Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit raided the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X on Tuesday morning, as part of a probe into alleged offences including political interference, unlawful data extraction and sexualised deepfakes of women and children. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know so far, in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Digital sovereignty (2/3): Can Europe‚Äôs businesses survive without US Big Tech?
events.description: Businesses in Europe are increasingly questioning their reliance on US technology amid fears that President Donald Trump might one day ‚Äúpull the plug‚Äù on the continent. In part two of our series on digital sovereignty, we look at the dangers of European dependency on American Big Tech ‚Äì and why decoupling from the US is easier said than done.

events.title: Netflix to livestream K-pop BTS comeback mega concert
events.description: Netflix will livestream BTS‚Äôs comeback concert to around 190 countries on March 21, marking one of the largest live K-pop events to date. The band, on hiatus since 2022 for mandatory military service, will release their new album ARIRANG on March 20 and perform a free concert in Seoul before starting a tour.

events.title: 'I still would like to meet Putin': Epstein's unrequited love for Russian leader
events.description: What has Vladimir Putin got to do with Jeffrey Epstein?

events.title: Teenage boy swims for four hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: A 13-year-old Australian boy has described battling "massive" waves to swim around four hours to shore and raise the alarm after his family were swept out to sea.

events.title: French investigators raid Paris offices of Elon Musk's X
events.description: Investigators have raided the Paris offices of Elon Musk's social media site X, formerly known as Twitter.

events.title: Son of Norway's crown princess denies rape as trial begins
events.description: The trial of the eldest son of Norway's crown princess on charges including rape has begun, after a set of new allegations were made against him.

events.title: Spain considers social media ban for under-16s, joining others in Europe
events.description: Spain's prime minister says that his government plans to ban social media access for children under 16

events.title: India's Modi praised for US trade deal as opposition questions impact on agriculture
events.description: Indian lawmakers from the ruling coalition praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for striking a deal with the U.S. to reduce tariffs on Indian goods

events.title: Palestinians line up to cross Rafah after rocky first day of reopening of Gaza-Egypt border crossing
events.description: A group of Palestinian patients treated in Egypt have arrived on the Egyptian side of the Rafah border crossing, hoping to return to Gaza with their families

events.title: 13-year-old swims for hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: A 13-year-old boy is credited with saving his family after they were swept out to sea off the Australian coast

events.title: Vatican's 'trial of the century' resumes after prosecutors suffer setbacks on appeal
events.description: The Vatican‚Äôs ‚Äútrial of the century‚Äù has resumed with appeals after setbacks for the pope‚Äôs prosecutors

events.title: Australia's central bank raises interest rate to 3.85% after 3 cuts
events.description: Australia‚Äôs central bank has lifted its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point to 3.85%, after three rate cuts last year and as inflation surges

events.title: Where is Evo Morales? Bolivia's ex-leader vanishes from public view for nearly a month
events.description: The nearly monthlong disappearance from public view of Bolivia‚Äôs towering socialist icon, ex-leader Evo Morales, just days after the Jan. 3 U.S. seizure of former Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, his close ally, is alarming his supporters, roiling ...

events.title: UN peacekeeping patrols suspended along Lebanon-Israel Blue Line
events.description: UN peacekeepers temporarily suspended patrols and other activities along parts of the ‚ÄòBlue Line‚Äô in southern Lebanon after the Israeli military said it would release what it described as a non-toxic chemical substance near the frontier, the UN said on Monday.

events.title: Gaza: Limited Rafah crossing reopening sparks hope ‚Äì but also ‚Äòmassive trepidation‚Äô
events.description: The reopening of the Rafah crossing in the southern Gaza Strip on Monday after more than a year is being met with both optimism and fear, a senior official with the UN agency that assists the Palestinian people, UNRWA, has said.

events.title: Invisible highways: The vast network of undersea cables powering our connectivity
events.description: Every day, we send countless emails, take part in video calls, use search engines and streaming services, while seamlessly banking online.

events.title: California parents who decapitated 2 children, forced other kids to see bodies learn sentence
events.description: California parents Maurice Taylor Sr. and Natalie Brothwell sentenced to life without parole for murdering their two children in their Lancaster home.

events.title: Erika Kirk urges court to provide 'meaningful' media access in trial of husband's alleged assassin
events.description: Charlie Kirk's widow demands media access in her husband's suspected assassin's trial, filing court documents to ensure proceedings remain open to public.

events.title: NASA delays Artemis moon mission after finding fuel leaks in test run
events.description: NASA said Tuesday that the launch of its Artemis II moon mission will be pushed back to March after fuel leaks were found during a test run this week.

events.title: US military shoots down Iranian drone approaching USS Abraham Lincoln in Arabian Sea, official says
events.description: The U.S. military shot down an Iranian drone after it "aggressively approached a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier with unclear intent," a CENTCOM spokesman said.

events.title: Australian teen swims 2.5 miles for hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: Teen hero swims 2.5 miles through rough seas to save family swept away by winds off Australia. Police praised the 13-year-old boy's courage.

events.title: Trump to host Colombia‚Äôs Petro as drug trafficking expected to dominate high-stakes talks
events.description: President Donald Trump and Colombia's Gustavo Petro meet Tuesday at the White House after a year of diplomatic turmoil, from deportation standoffs to visa revocations and trade tensions.
